meanings.definition: To achieve success beyond what is expected or required.
meanings.sent1: She overachieved in her exams by scoring much higher than anyone thought she would.
meanings.sent2: The team overachieved this season by winning every game in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The little ant overachieved by carrying a huge crumb all the way back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: The student overachieved like a shooting star, surpassing all expectations in the science fair.
meanings.sent5: His dedication and hard work allowed him to overachieve and reach his goals.

meanings.definition: To perform better than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: The athlete overachieved in the race, finishing first despite being the underdog.
meanings.sent2: The chef overachieved in the kitchen, creating a masterpiece dish that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat overachieved in catching the mouse, surprising even itself with its speed.
meanings.sent4: The plant overachieved in growth, reaching towering heights in just a few weeks.
meanings.sent5: The student overachieved in the math test, solving every problem with ease.
